intro: Sidalcea parviflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to lavender-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sidalcea parviflora is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
